description: From Middle English hostesse, from Middle French hostesse, from Old French ostesce, made up of oste (“host”) + -esce (“feminine marker”).

examples: The host and hostess greeted their guests at the door.

entries.meaning: Stewardess: a woman steward on an airplane.
A bar hostess or bargirl; a paid female companion offering conversation and in some cases sex.

verbs.description: hostess (third-person singular simple present hostesses, present participle hostessing, simple past and past participle hostessed)

examples: Later in January, the alum club hostessed the initiation brunch at the Pi Beta Phi chapter house. It was thrilling to see so many girls with such enthusiasm!
